column4: Hi, I have a question about Ubuntu 8.04 LTS. I upgraded like 4 days ago it was somethin like: Ubuntu 8.04 LTS Hardy Heron (release candidate), so I suppose that was not the definitive version, so now I want to upgrade again to the definitive version, but when I go to "update manager" it says: an error has occured, W: GPG error: http://tskariah.000webhost.com ubuntu Release: The following signatures couldn't be verified because the public key is not available:
NO_PUBKEY B5E73308E22CF38B.   How can I upgrade to the definitive version that is supposed to be available now????
Remove that source, it's not official, and we have no idea where it came from.
The updating and that error are two different things, you should remove that repository from your sources
http://tskariah.000webhost.com, edit /etc/apt/sources.list (alt-f2 then `gksu "gedit /etc/apt/sources.list"`), remove the line that that URL is in (it's probably near the bottom)
it worked fine
please don't do that
You'll need to give us a bit more information than that.  IMAP? pop? etc.  What do you mean by loading?
POP I think
I mean, loading old mails as new, like something I received days ago, read days ago and today I get it again as a new mail

ubottu I know it has to be on wine, I just dunno if it would work well because they info on that appdb thing is quite old, and otherwise I think the installation will be quite complicate, so I was wondering if someone has played it recently on ubuntu and if you know where I could find orientation for the installation process
Attaching is attaching, there's no difference
but to send pics to a cell phone it has to be attached as a photo
attached as a photo is no different than a regular attachment
if I attach it as any other file as is the only option hotmail on ubuntu would give me, it would fail
Are you trying to include a photo in an HTML email perhaps?  "Attaching as a photo" doesn't make sense.
if you have a hotmail account check what options it gives you on the attach button, on Ubuntu, and then check out on Windows
I am trying to send a photo to a cellphone
I just asked someone to check in windows, and hotmail doesn't have an "attach as" just "attach" and then a file dialog.
maybe on Vista
regardless, email has no notion of attaching "as a photo" just attaching files, which happen to be photos.
So, you should try and figure out what your cell phone is asking.  However, we're offtopic, you may want to ask in #ubuntu-offtopic, someone there may know what you're talking about
ok, thanks
